decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to control the opponent's draws and board state using cards like Lantern of Insight, Codex Shredder, and Ensnaring Bridge. By disrupting the opponent's strategy and denying them the ability to draw relevant cards, the deck aims to grind out incremental advantages until it can win the game through Infernal Tutor or other win conditions. The deck also utilizes cards like Pithing Needle and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats and protect its own game plan. With a mix of disruption, card selection, and win conditions, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver its opponent.

The key focus of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to keep the opponent's board in check. By utilizing cards like Supreme Verdict and Path to Exile, along with planeswalkers like Gideon Jura and Jace, Architect of Thought, the deck aims to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes card draw and mana fixing tools like Serum Visions and Detention Sphere to ensure consistency in gameplay. Additionally, the inclusion of land hate cards like Spreading Seas and Ghost Quarter offers disruption against opponent's mana bases.

The deck focuses on generating mana efficiently with cards like Pyretic Ritual and Baral, Chief of Compliance to cast powerful spells like Grapeshot and Gifts Ungiven. By combining these cards together, the deck can quickly assemble a lethal storm count and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells. The goal is to reach a critical mass of spells to either burn the opponent out with Grapeshot or create a massive army with Empty the Warrens. Cards like Goblin Electromancer and Manamorphose help to streamline the combo and increase its consistency.

This aggro deck focuses on disrupting opponents with tax effects like Thalia and Leonin Arbiter, while using efficient Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Wasteland Strangler to apply pressure. The deck also utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and Eldrazi Displacer for additional disruption. Dark Confidant provides card advantage while Flickerwisp provides versatility. The mana base includes utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Shambling Vent to further disrupt opponents. Overall, this Death and Taxes deck aims to control the game with disruptive creatures and tax effects while applying aggressive pressure.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly to cast Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle in order to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck includes cards like Farseek, Explore, and Primeval Titan to search out lands and increase the chances of triggering Valakut's ability. The inclusion of Prismatic Omen ensures that all lands are considered mountains, maximizing the damage output. This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win the game through sheer burst damage.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap artifact creatures and boosting their power with artifacts like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer. Its aim is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures and efficient removal spells, such as Galvanic Blast. The mana base includes color-fixing lands like Spire of Industry and the artifact lands to support the affinity mechanic. With a mix of evasion, pump spells, and resilient threats like Etched Champion, the deck aims to be aggressive and difficult to interact with.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play Primeval Titan and Scapeshift, ultimately leading to a combo where Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle deals a massive amount of damage to the opponent. Cards like Search for Tomorrow, Farseek, and Wood Elves help accelerate mana production, while Prismatic Omen ensures all lands are Mountains to maximize Valakut's ability. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Sweltering Suns to control the game until the combo can be assembled. Relic of Progenitus provides graveyard hate, and Summoner's Pact helps find key combo pieces.

The main idea behind this deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal spells, while also utilizing land disruption and card advantage to outlast opponents. The deck aims to stabilize the board with powerful board wipes like Supreme Verdict, protect its threats with counterspells like Mana Leak and Cryptic Command, and generate card advantage with cards like Serum Visions and Snapcaster Mage. By controlling the game and out-valuing opponents, this deck can grind out victories in the long game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by utilizing low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and prevent them from stabilizing by using efficient removal spells like Searing Blaze and Lightning Helix. Boros Charm and Skullcrack provide additional reach and utility to close out games swiftly. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to execute its game plan efficiently.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. It also includes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with its aggressive Eldrazi creatures and use cards like Karn Liberated for additional removal and card advantage. With a mix of big threats and disruption, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by imposing taxes on their actions while also applying early aggression with efficient creatures. It utilizes cards like Leonin Arbiter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down the opponent's mana development, while cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Tidehollow Sculler disrupt their hand and remove key threats. The deck also has a flicker subtheme, allowing for clever interactions with cards like Flickerwisp and Eldrazi Displacer to gain additional value and further disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with aggressive Merfolk creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Spreading Seas and Cursecatcher. The Aether Vial allows for creatures to be put onto the battlefield without using mana, while cards like Master of Waves and Lord of Atlantis boost the power of the Merfolk creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, consistent stream of creature threats while also providing some control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on playing powerful Eldrazi creatures as quickly as possible, utilizing the efficient mana production of Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple. The deck also includes disruption elements like Chalice of the Void and Dismember to control the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer while also having tools like Karn Liberated and All Is Dust for removal and card advantage. The goal is to apply pressure early and maintain control of the game through powerful creature threats.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It employs control elements such as counterspells, bounce spells, and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan while digging through the deck with card draw spells like Thirst for Knowledge. The deck also includes powerful win conditions like Wurmcoil Engine, Mindslaver, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to close out the game once it has established control. Overall, the key concept revolves around mana ramp, disruption, and powerful late-game threats in order to outvalue opponents.

This deck aims to quickly generate mana and card advantage with spells like Manamorphose and Gifts Ungiven, while also controlling the opponent's actions with counter spells like Remand. By efficiently chaining together spells and generating storm count, the deck can cast Empty the Warrens or Grapehot to deal massive amounts of damage in a single turn. The inclusion of Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer reduces the cost of spells, making it easier to combo off and win the game.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp into big Eldrazi creatures using mana acceleration from cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Gemstone Caverns. Chalice of the Void is used to disrupt the opponent's game plan by locking out certain mana costs, while Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher provide both disruption and powerful attackers. The deck also includes cards like Eternal Scourge and Endless One to provide a more aggressive early game. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, high-impact threats.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana and card advantage to build up to a powerful storm count, allowing the player to cast a large number of spells in a single turn and finish off the opponent with a lethal Grapeshot. Baral and Goblin Electromancer help reduce the cost of spells, while Gifts Ungiven allows for strategic card selection. The deck also includes Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard and maintain the storm chain. Overall, the deck aims to create a fast and efficient storm combo to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on assembling Urza's lands (UrzaTron) to generate massive amounts of mana quickly, allowing for powerful spells and threats to be played ahead of schedule. It utilizes control elements such as Karn Liberated, Wurmcoil Engine, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to control the opponent's board while ramping into powerful Eldrazi finishers like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck also includes tools for consistency such as Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying, ensuring that the necessary pieces are found quickly to overwhelm the opponent.

This aggro deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently using low-cost, high-impact spells and creatures. By combining burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike with efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck looks to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan. The inclusion of cards like Skullcrack and Eidolon of the Great Revel helps to disrupt the opponent's strategies and prevent them from gaining life or casting spells comfortably. The deck focuses on being proactive and keeping the pressure on the opponent at all times.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces needed to generate a large amount of mana and cast multiple spells in a single turn to create a storm count. By using cards like Pyretic Ritual, Manamorphose, and Desperate Ritual, along with Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce costs, the deck aims to use Grapeshot as a finisher to deal lethal damage to the opponent. Gifts Ungiven is used to tutor for key spells like Past in Flames, allowing the player to cast multiple spells from their graveyard and continue the combo.
